title: (x) Courtney Love from KNI - Escrita {Yves}
content:
Fits Courtney like a glove ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124249im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) I guess it's not a font (altought the O's are almost similar)?   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124249im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/28887.gif)
author: adriano

comments.content: Didn't knew that font from Mï¿½rio's work. Thanks Yves!

You know, I had been looking at an ad for her new album and was thinking, "Jeez, I hate her, but at least her designer didn't use a font for this." Got me on that one. I hadn't looked closely at the album title, which did have obviously repeating letters, but the designer did distress her name enough so that the letters didn't repeat exactly (on the ad I have, which is a little different than the sample above). So I guess I'll give the designer moderate props for fooling me. That's what I think a designer should do with a handwriting font for a logo such as this.   
   
Good call, Yves.

Escrita has a number of alternate characters that gives you even more range. That's why the 'e' in the Test Drive was different from the sample. I have a showing with most of the various alternates in the Script Font ID Guide at [http://bowfinprintworks.com/Script13Pg3.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124249/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script13Pg3.html)

Now if Courtney Love could only stay off the David Letterman show and keep her clothes on and stop assaulting fans she'd be great. If you don't know what I'm refering to see the New York Daily News or the New York Post online today. She is just a charmer.
I know -- flashing Letterman is so...Drew Barrymore circa 1995.
